title: how to print grids from indesign?
content:
hey, how is everybody doing,

i need some help guys, is it possible to print my grids from indesign (cs3) i’m working on this book layout but would like to print just the grids

i tryed looking it up in the indesign manual and i think i have seen it in there somewhere but i can’t seem to find it again.

thanks in advance

 [‹ "What font says change?" An article on campaign type](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312105016/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41806 "Go to previous forum topic") [Mathamatical grid ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312105016/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42170 "Go to next forum topic")
author: omar

comments.content:
I’m not sure about CS3, but on CS2, you can do it by enabling ’Print Visible Guides and Baseline Grids’ (File \> Print Presets \> Define \> Edit \> General)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312105016im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Print_Preset_4348.jpg)

If you’re not printing separations, you want to choose “Print Visible Guides and Baseline Grids” from General when you bring up the Print dialog box. Assuming you pick two blank pages, that’s all you’ll get.
thnx a ton for the help writingdesigning and Linda, i appreciate it.
